definition: to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
variant of 挽[wan3]/to draw (a cart)/to lament the dead
to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover

sentences.english: Who can now tell them apart?
The miracle, likes a star candy, which turns the tide.
sentences.chinese: 就像臭蛋中的星星糖一样，她是能够力挽狂澜的奇迹。

sentences.english: So how could Democrats salvage things?
sentences.chinese: 那么民主党将如何力挽狂澜呢？

sentences.english: QiaoJinFan help company tide, the directors look favourably upon him.
sentences.chinese: 乔津帆帮公司力挽狂澜，董事们对他另眼相看。

sentences.english: Even with this team, I managed to win.
sentences.chinese: 尽管队友如此，我还是力挽狂澜。

sentences.english: In both games they had a giant in the goal who saved everything and performed like the best keeper in the world.
sentences.chinese: 双方都有能力挽狂澜的高手，有世界上最好的门将。

definition: lit. to upend heaven and earth (idiom)/fig. to change the course of events/to turn things around
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
